intro: Crepis krameri, commonly known as the Krameri's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Crepis krameri is often found in disturbed habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
